intro: Languas longilora, commonly known as the long-stemmed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hair to retain moisture. Languas longilora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
